circumstances: After takeoff from the bay of Avalon, the twin engine seaplane lost height and crashed into the sea. A passenger was killed while three other occupants were injured, the pilot seriously.
probable_cause:
Airframe failure during initial climb after the elevator tab control system failed. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Inadequate maintenance and inspection, 
- Fatigue fracture, 
- Up elevator cable separated 3 to 4 feet forward of station 29.
